text: @StephenCurry30 @rogbennett @NIAIDNews A Chinese study (via The Lancet) shows positive tests for COVID19 in fecal samples an average of 11.2 days after respiratory tests are negative. Does this mean infected patients remain contagious for that period of time? Is this being accounted for in treatment here in The US?
